definition: unexpected/hard to imagine/it had not occurred to me/who could have thought that
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Someone you least expect could be trying to make you look bad.
sentences.chinese: 有人可能會想讓你出醜，這個人是你意想不到的。

sentences.english: If negativity does happen, it will probably come unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 如果否定性發生，它將意想不到地大概來。

sentences.english: One cannot imagine mere human beings concocting such dreadful things, and one can scarcely imagine human beings bearing life in them.
sentences.chinese: 更令人想不到的是，居然還有人類在其中繁衍生息。

sentences.english: Keep in mind, jealousy may pop up when you least expect it.
sentences.chinese: 記住，嫉妒感會在你最意想不到的時候竄出來。

sentences.english: Too often they have unintended consequences, helping to create the next disaster.
sentences.chinese: 它們常常帶來意想不到的結果，可能產生下一場災難。

sentences.english: Inspiration might come from someplace you never imagined.
sentences.chinese: 靈感可能從任何你想也想不到的地方噴薄而發。

sentences.english: If will come to you when you least expect it.
sentences.chinese: 牠會甾伱最意想不到惪時候麳到伱身邊。

sentences.english: Unexpected behavior caused by changes in focus, or incorrect setting of focus.
sentences.chinese: 焦點改變或者不正確設置造成的意想不到的行爲。

sentences.english: I'm afraid the unexpected accident may botch up the dinner today.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕這意想不到的事故會把今天的晚宴搞糟。

sentences.english: I don't see many other world class left-backs available.
sentences.chinese: 我想不到比他更適合這個位置的世界級左後衛人選。

sentences.english: Spring passed and then summer, and still Benaiah had no idea where he could find the ring.
sentences.chinese: 春去夏來，本奈還是想不到該往何處找尋此戒指。

sentences.english: Angle at any time as fish are often swimming at the place out of your expectation.
sentences.chinese: 要隨時撒下魚鉤，魚兒常在你最料想不到的地方遊動。

sentences.english: But that unexpected sight at the foot of my brothers bed was it for me.
sentences.chinese: 但意想不到的視線，在山下我的兄弟牀，是它爲我。

sentences.english: The payoff of a successful attack is unimaginable.
sentences.chinese: 成功攻擊的結果是意想不到的。

sentences.english: The most surprising weapon was the double-barrel shotgun.
sentences.chinese: 最意想不到的武器是雙筒獵槍。

sentences.english: But the one area that posed an unexpected challenge was grocery shopping.
sentences.chinese: 但是，日常用品這一項就造成意想不到的挑戰。

definition: unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
